constituent: review, gates, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs
heisigStory: Gates . . . devil. Keep the connotation of this key word distinct from those of inspection (Frame 1174), revise (Frame 362), and perusal (Frame 919).
koohiiStory1: A little devil at the gates of hell reviews your record to see if you´re evil enough to get in.
koohiiStory2: As I was reviewing for my exam at a quiet saloon, the devil popped out of nowhere and offered to make sure I pass. But I told him no way, since that´s cheating. Besides, I´m just reviewing things I already know. I won´t fail. But he kept insisting, so I kicked him and sent him crashing through the entrance gates.
